intro: Cynoglossum sabirense, commonly known as the Sabirian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
